From the users perspective I doubt two libraries will be any better than one in this case. What a user would benefit from is clear and exhaustive documentation with many examples. An area where we admittedly are lacking greatly at the moment but certainly is high priority. Solid documentation could easily rid any confusion of when to use OAuth 1 or 2. 

Regarding when to use OAuth 1 or 2 I've opened issue #118 .
Clarifying that oauthlib separates 1 and 2 is now issue #117 .
One thing I've been meaning to add is a F.A.Q. for clients and providers to address common issues quickly. I've opened issue #119  tracking this.

The reason the documentation is lacking is twofold. Firstly I avoid writing documentation before I feel the interface has matured enough to be usable by users uninterested in digging into internals themselves. Until then the unittests and code serve as documentation. Secondly, I currently can't spend nearly as much time as I'd like on OAuthLib.
